result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody A. Janis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cody A. Janis in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Defendant Cody A. Janis in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CM207, 15CM354, 15CM426, 15CM472 and 16CM67.

10:30 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CM207:
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - No contest
Count 3 - DRI
Count 4 - No contest
Count 5 - DRI

15CM354:
Count 1 - DRI

15CM426:
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - DRI

15CM472:
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI

16CM67:
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - No contest
Count 3 - DRI
Count 4 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1, 2 & 4 of 15CM207 and Count 3 & 5 DRI; Count 1 of 15CM354 DRI; Guilty on Count 1 of 15CM426 and Count 2 DRI; Guilty on Count 1 of 15CM472 and Count 2 & 3 DRI and Guilty on Count 1 & 2 16CM67 and Count 3 & 4 DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CM207:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay 60 day jail sentence concurrent to Count 2 & 4 and consecutive to 16CM67, 15CM426 and 15CM472 
If Probation Revoked:
*Huber priveleges for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow
*To be completed on electronic home monitor if approved after jail assessment 
*10 days jail credit 
Placed on Probation for 24 months
**Conditions of Probation concurrent to 16CM67
*Comply with conditions in 16CM67 
*Pay fine of $150 plus costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*Bond to be applied to restitution and then costs

Count 2 - 
Impose/Stay 60 day jail sentence concurrent to Count 1 & 4 and consecutive to 16CM67, 15CM426 and 15CM472 
If Probation Revoked:
*Huber priveleges for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow
*To be completed on electronic home monitor if approved after jail assessment 
Placed on Probation for 24 months
**Conditions of Probation concurrent to 16CM67
*Comply with conditions in 16CM67 
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA surcharge
*Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge

Count 3 - DRI

Count 4 -
Impose/Stay 60 day jail sentence concurrent to Count 1 & 2 and consecutive to 16CM67, 15CM426 and 15CM472 
If Probation Revoked:
*Huber priveleges for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow
*To be completed on electronic home monitor if approved after jail assessment 
Placed on Probation for 24 months
**Conditions of Probation concurrent to 16CM67
*Comply with conditions in 16CM67 
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 5 - DRI

15CM354:
Count 1 - DRI

15CM426:
Count 1 -
*30 day straight jail sentence - Huber priveleges for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow
*Time served jail sentence 
*Jail credit of 45 days 
*Pay costs 
*Pay DNA surcharge
*Provide DNA sample 
*Bond to be applied to costs

Count 2 - DRI

15CM472:
Count 1 -
*30 day jail sentence consecutive to 15CM426 - Huber priveleges for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow
*Time served jail sentence
*45 days jail credit 
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI

16CM67:
Count 1 - 
Impose/Stay 9 month jail sentence concurrent to Count 2 but consecutive to 15CM426 and 15CM472 
If probation revoked:
*Huber priveleges for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow
*Allow to serve second half on electronic monitor if approved after jail assessment 
*2 days jail credit 
Placed on Probation for 24 months 
**Conditions of Probation:
*AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
*Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to illegal drugs or substances 
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
*Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
*Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
*Obtain all prescriptions from one pharmacy and notify agent of pharmacy
*Sign all necessary releases of information for agent.
*Obtain and maintain full-time employment.
*Participate in any counseling or assessments recommended by the agent.
*No abusive contact with Kayla Mosey
*Participate in Domestic Abuse Program that the agent recommends
*Pay restitution in the amount of $167.50 to the Stevens Point Housing Authority 
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 2 -
Impose/Stay 9 month jail sentence concurrent to Count 1 but consecutive to 15CM426 and 15CM472 
If probation revoked:
*Huber priveleges for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow
*Allow to serve second half on electronic monitor if approved after jail assessment  
Placed on Probation for 24 months - concurrent with Count 1

records.addlTxt: Notice of Motion and Defense Motion for Modification of Bond Regarding No Contact Provision filed by Atty Acalia Halverson

Defendant Cody A. Janis appeared by video.  Attorney Acalia N Halverson in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea entered to all cases. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 

Atty Halverson makes statements re: no contact.  
Atty Cousins makes arguments in opposition. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond is continued as previously ordered.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 09:00 am.

$5,000 cash bond:
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
  Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.
Comply with all other bonds in his pending cases.

1:18 p.m. ADA Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Possess Controlled Substance and Bail Jump.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a cash bond  with conditions as stated.
Cases 15CM472, 15CM354, 15CM207, 15CM426 are return on warrants.  Warrants quashed. (15CM472 needs to be set for initial too - check with ADA)
BTC: Court sets bond for 16GF45
Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  02-08-16  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3
